title: One-Pan Cajun Pork Sausage Skillet
directions: Core, deseed, and dice bell pepper into 1/2" pieces. Halve, peel, and dice onion into 1/2" pieces. Dice tomato into 1/2" pieces.
Remove sausage from casing. Discard casing.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook, breaking up meat into pieces until browned, 3 - 4 minutes (it'll finish cooking later).
Using a slotted spoon, transfer sausage to a paper-towel-lined plate, keeping as much oil in pan as possible.

Heat another drizzle of oil in the same pan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and diced onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until veggies are lightly browned, 2 - 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add rice, diced tomato, tomato paste, Cajun Spice, 1 tsp salt, and a pinch of pepper to pan with veggies. Cook, stirring frequently, 30 seconds.
Add stock concentrates and 3 cups water to pan and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, until liquid is reduced by half, 3 - 4 minutes.
Return sausage to pan. Cover pan and reduce heat to low. Cook until rice is tender, 15 - 18 minutes.
While rice cooks, pick parsley leaves from stems. Finely chop leaves.
In a small browl, combine sour cream with half the chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency.
Stir remaining chopped parsley into rice skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with Monterey Jack and parsley crema.
